head.title: Saxonica: XSLT and XQuery Processing: Controlling Validation from Java

meta.name: title
meta.content: Saxonica: XSLT and XQuery Processing: Controlling Validation from Java

body.p: Schema validation can be controlled either using the standard JAXP Java interface, or using Saxon's own s9api interface. The two approaches are described in the following sections. The main advantage of using JAXP is that it is portable; the main advantage of s9api is that it is better integrated across the range of Saxon XML processing interfaces.
